cyclone.name: LIDIA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles SSE of Cabo San Lucas, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest across southern Baja California Sur, then forecast to turn northwest and move back over the Pacific Ocean west of the Baja Peninsula, remaining well south-west of southern California.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern tip of the Baja California Peninsula near Cabo San Lucas

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Punta Abreojos to Punta Eugenia and from Mulege to Bahia De Los Angeles, and mainland Mexico north of Bahia Kino to Puerto Libertad.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Puerto Abreojos to Mulege, and mainland Mexico from Bahia Tempehuaya to Bahia Kino. Hurricane Watch from Puerto Cortes to east of La Paz, Baja California Sur.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Baja California Sur, central-western Mexico, eventually the Pacific waters west of Baja.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<5%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible late Sunday into Monday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer moisture plumes could bring light to locally moderate showers (generally <1 inch).
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased surf and dangerous rip currents along Southern California beaches Sunday–Monday.
